review: I regret buying Amazon Fire. I should have purchased another ROKU but I was taken in by the hype. I have slow DSL 3mb download and the Fire certainly flickers. Last night I was watching a program on the FIre and it constantly lost video while audio continued. I gave up, went to another room and viewed the show on ROKU with no problem. Also, voice command only works for Amazon Prime and manual search defaluts to Amazon Prime.
author: Alliji "God's girl"

review: I've had numerous smart Blu-Ray players, Roku's, the Xbox in every flavor - this tiny little black box KICKS THEIR COLLECTIVE BUTTS.  Guess what?  When you select something to watch and hit play, (hold on to your hats!) it PLAYS!  There is virtually no such thing as buffering on this device - none.To be fair, I have a 50/10 cable connection to the internet, so I shouldn't expect much buffering issues anyway, but that wasn't how it was with the other devices.  If I hit play, it would sit and buffer for anywhere from 3 to 20 seconds before it would play.  This thing just PLAYS.Using the Plex app, we can stream anything we have ripped to a computer in our home, combined with Netflix, Hulu and PRIME, life is very, very good.  I am going to get one of these for all the sets in my home.  2 down, 2 to go!Can't wait for the Prime Music upgrade, coming soon!
